AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: The only visible ATLAS content is a brief intake flow requesting uploads; there’s no clear incorrect/misleading guidance shown, and the human team took over afterward.
evidence: ATLAS: "If you have any 📃 log files or 🖼️ screenshots to upload to help with the troubleshooting, now is the time to do it"

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: Customer was not stuck in an AI-only loop; a human agent responded and progressed troubleshooting.
evidence: 2025-10-22: Human agent (Randall) provides specific findings and commands to run

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support requested shell commands without first ensuring the customer had the required shell unlock key/licensing to execute them, causing avoidable back-and-forth and delays. This indicates the support flow did not account for a common access prerequisite in this environment.
evidence: Randall (2025-10-22): "I need you to run the following commands and provide the output" (followed by multiple shell commands).
Customer (2025-10-23): "Please provide us with the shell license key to execute these commands."

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: Multiple gaps exceed 3 calendar days, and the customer/partner explicitly chased for updates. Support also apologized for the delay.
evidence: Gap: 2025-10-14 (ticket created) to 2025-10-22 (first substantive human response).
Gap: Customer request for shell key on 2025-10-23 to key provided on 2025-10-27.
Customer follow-ups during wait: 2025-10-26 "Please any update here? ... ASAP." and 2025-10-27 "Please need your support here urgently."
Gap: Customer requests Webex again on 2025-10-30 and follow-up 2025-11-02; meeting scheduler only sent 2025-11-03.
Syed (2025-11-04): "I sincerely apologize for the delayed response on this ticket."

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: The ticket shows continued engagement (meeting scheduled/held and remediation steps taken). No evidence is shown that the case was closed while a customer request was pending.
evidence: 2025-11-04: Meeting held and actions performed; follow-up guidance provided

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: While the customer didn’t explicitly state a full outage, they reported a recurring disk-full/performance issue and repeatedly emphasized urgency/criticality. Handling did not reflect urgency (multi-day delays and slow scheduling of the requested live session).
evidence: Initial issue: "Exinda Network Orchestrator Performance Issue and the disk space is full... issue reoccurs and persists."
Partner/customer escalation (2025-10-26): "We are at critical stage and must expediate all the tasks..." and request "ASAP" for the shell key.
Customer/partner chase for meeting (2025-11-02): "Please can you get back to us ASAP on the requested Webex call?"
Multi-day response gaps documented under RESPONSE_DELAYS.
